conclusion: Analyze forces to find angle θ and coefficient of friction μ.
Identify forces: gravitational, normal, applied, and frictional.
Normal force acts upward, applied force at angle θ, frictional force proportional to normal force.
Resolve applied force into horizontal (F cos θ) and vertical (F sin θ) components.
Horizontal equilibrium: F cos θ = μN.
Vertical equilibrium: N + F sin θ = mg.
Substitute N from vertical into horizontal: F cos θ = μ(mg - F sin θ).
Rearrange to solve for μ: μ = F cos θ / (mg - F sin θ).
Given F = 90 N, m = 15 kg, g = 10 m/s², F_g = 150 N.
Calculate μ: μ = 90 cos θ / (150 - 90 sin θ).
Determine θ for minimum force: test θ = 37°.
